{{item:3070}} 

This might be a bit long winded and useless, depends on where your general skill level is.
---
Top tho, your job is mostly just outlast them.
Sustain them to death. Don't be super aggressive, but force trades or loss of cs for them continually.
Eventually you should be able to force them under tower with very little health.
If they recall, you don't recall, just stay and outlevel them.
If they don't recall, ask jungle to set up a dive and kill them.

**Get good at cleaver harassment.**

Get good at proper warding timing so you don't get a surprise jungle gank. (Mundo doesn't care too much if he gets ganked, or even camped, just as long as they don't catch you out, and off guard.)

By proper ward timing. I mean, if you see the enemy jungler bot lane, don't waste a ward at that time.
If you're close to your tower, don't ward.
If you get enemy under their tower and are either trying to set up dive or make them recall.
WARD THAT BITCH.
And watch it. You want to be ready to cleaver the jungler in the face the second he shows up in your lane, otherwise you're a dead mundo.
Dead mundos are sad, cause usually mundos don't please to go to fountain.

But don't necessarily back off as soon as the enemy jungler shows his face. Mundo can 2v1 fairly well. And by that I don't mean try to go ham and get a double kill alone.
Just hold him up, waste his time. Let your jungler get ahead.

Mundo can 1v1 fairly well though. But patience is the key. Harass the hell out of them, every time they make a misstep, cleaver them in the face.
Every time they want a tank minion, cleaver in the face.
Every time they flash their mastery emote, cleaver in the face.
Even when you think they are low enough to kill. Don't go in for the kill immediately. Just moar cleaver in the face.
Then, just when they think you're not going to do anything except annoy the fk out of them with cleavers, then you kill them.

Mundo can roam well, but can't waveclear great. So you'll have to watch the timing on waves pretty carefully when you want to go out.
He can waveclear pretty fast if enemy laner recalls though. Just turn w on and run into middle of the pack. But if enemy laner/jungler is anywhere near, that's generally a bad idea. It'll cost you a lot of hp, and a decent chance you'll get creep blocked, and you can't cleaver whoever is coming up to hit you right away till you get out of the pack of minions. Just consider yourself very vulnerable while you are waveclearing. Only do it when you know you're perfectly safe.

As far as builds, it's pretty boring. Pretty much always want a {{item:3211}} into {{item:3065}} pretty early, regardless of enemy team.
{{item:3111}} or {{item:3047}} depending on who's the most annoying on enemy team.
Lots of hp.
{{item:3751}} {{item:3068}} is still pretty good on him I believe. Makes the waveclear faster/safer. Double AoE burn for team fights is nice (though they cut that back a bit).

Yeh, something like that.
Except you lack the trollpool 'woops i wasn't watching for jungler, get out of gank free card'
(I know it's not that simple, I play a decent amount of old and new vlad, but, still, it is a pretty good 'save your stupid ass' button.)

With Mundo, if jungler ganks, you're basically required to land a max range cleaver to not die, or at least be forced to burn flash and then lose all lane bully powers you had.
But, land 1 good cleaver, then just calmly walk back and you should be good for another round.

Or if jungler wants to be an ass and camp after the failed gank, you should be able to just sit under tower 2v1'ing all day and hope your team can win game 4v3.
(Usually better to not call for jungler help if you're under tower 2v1. I mean it's situational. If they're being REALLY stupid agro, your jungler could prolly get a doublekill out of it. But if they're just passive cockblocking your lane, prolly best to just weather it out.)

Just hope your team recognizes your sacrifice of a very dull, tedious lane for the greater good.

But if their jungler isn't an ass, and mostly leaves you alone, it can be a pretty amusing lane phase. And might just tilt enemy top laner. Cleavers can be really frustrating, lol

Solo lane you can just go Grasp with typical AS+AD runes. I mostly Jungle him for both SR and TT. I don't have any recent TT games in my match history as Mundo though.
Runes/Masteries: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2529221819/31948940?tab=builds
TT build even for today: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1997424598/31948940?tab=overview

General things to keep in mind:
-Last hitting with Q will heal you, as the refund when you last hit is increased by the mastery and visage
-Using E is an auto attack reset
-With Q he is good at taking jungle objectives, on SR he can solo all dragons at level 4/after a single jungle clear with just refil and red smite or refil+red smite+ruby crystal. Just smite after taking some damage and use both potions then smite again if you need to.
-On SR he can do rift herald pretty quickly especially with E being an AA reset to quickly hit the eye and Qs damage
-He can easily duo Baron with someone and same for spider last I did it a while ago, unless it changed he can solo the spider

He's a pretty good 1v1er as well, even against champions early on like Lee, and he can invade well too on SR right after 1st 2 buffs against junglers that get low like Kha. For the SR match you'll see I first blooded the Kha @ 2:43

I prefer to play him with 18/0/12 using deathfire touch.  I use hybrid pen red, armor yellow, scaling mr blue, and attack speed quints.

Start and max Q first, max w second if against someone with CC and E second if against someone lacking CC.  Play really passively until you get your ult just last hitting with your Q which will actually heal you with the 8% bonus healing from runic armor.  Mundo isn't much of a team fighter unless he is fed so you should mostly just focus on pushing lanes and trying to draw attention to yourself in a similar way as Singed.

For items, mostly just get tank items.  Some items you can get to do insane amounts of damage with your Q are Liandry's and sorc boots though.  My typical build on him is {{item:3065}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3512}}  and one of {{item:3020}} {{item:3047}}  depending on what is needed more that game.

Something to remember is that while his W drains his health, it also provides him with tenacity.  While running away from people with low health it may be good to turn it on for the reduced cc effect even if it isn't burning anyone.

Here are some example games.

This was a normal game where I built full tank and split pushed.
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2518457457/209287161?tab=overview

This game I felt I needed some good %hp damage for Nunu and Tahm so I built offensively and grouped.  We lost but I still dealt a lot of damage with the build.
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2518521366/209287161?tab=stats
thanks for the info, i was considering grasp of the undying, it that no longer visble?

I feel that the healing from grasp isn't that good compared to the rest of his kit and deathfire does more damage through the game.  In team fights you can apply deathfire touch to everyone you touch with your w while you will generally only be auto attacking 1 person.  DFT also does a decent amount of damage early game after cleavers.  Another reason is that I prefer the magic penetration over legendary guardian and swiftness.

Also, if you want to try him in the jungle you can use this as a build template.  I also sometimes like to grab a ruby sightstone on mundo in the jungle if my team is behind.  Always having 3 extra wards out really helps and mundo doesn't lose much by building it.  He doesn't need any stat besides health so 500 health is never wasted.

Been playing alot of mundo lately, and this is how i build him

AS reds/Scaling hp yellows/MR blues/1 AS+2 movement quints.

0/12/18

Q>E>Q>W, Q>E>W max, but at 8 go W instead of E so yuo farm a bit easier.

i play jungle and start red buff and ask for a strong leash.  Kite the mob in between hits/clevers and kill it.  Kill wolves, Q big wolf auto+e+a the small wolves down, throwing a clever at the big one on cd.  Kill blue and smite it but not till the end, kill gromp.  From here either invade or kill the scuttle.  Depedning on where the scuttle ends up when you killed it you may be able to invade vs some slower junglers.  You'll still have smite, and can win duels with his Q and E.

now im a terrible junglers, so i farm and only gank if  the oppurtunty is there when im at the camp by that lane.  I'l rarely run across the map or run to that side if no camp is there unless they're pushed way in.

  Prioritize farming you need to get tank stats.  A fed/even mundo can be a big threat, but a behind mundo is almost worthless most of the game.

for a build i do machete+3pots>ruby crystal+cloth armor+boots+Refillable potion (optional), giants belt/boots upgrade, boots/giants belt, giants belt (a 2nd one), then i build spirit visage, warmogs, deadmans plate,   in no particular order, but I may get kindlegems for the 10% cdr, and blue/red smite somewhere in there early, color depending on team comps.

Lastly get a phantom dancer if you wanna have fun ;).  Get it early

Only pick him into AP champs or pray the enemy forgets that Executioner's Calling exists.

Play safe early and cs with cleaver. Sunfire and Spirit Visage are core. After that you generally build tank items depending on what you need. Abyssal or Titanic is good for damage; zz'rot to push in towers in side lanes; Dead Man's for mobility; Randuin's, Thornmail, or Adaptive helm for specific carries that are becoming problematic.

Spam Q on targets to stick to them so your Funfire + W + autos (with E) can kill them.

Mundo's not really great at split pushing deep because he has no dashes, but he can and should push out side lanes since Sunfire + W does it very quickly and he's most likely less vulnerable than a mage or adc, especially if his ult is up.
